author: alastairs
body: [Homebrew](https://brew.sh) is the standard community-developed and -supported package manager for OS X. It would be awesome to be able to `brew install powershell`.

comments.author: titussanchez
comments.body:
It's available if you install [Homebrew Cask](https://caskroom.github.io/).

```
brew tap caskroom/cask
brew cask install powershell
```

comments.author: patrickobrien
comments.body:
brew told me to use:
`brew install Caskroom/cask/powershell`

edit: and it worked!

comments.author: amuessig
comments.body:
Not working for me :/ 
 # 'brew install Caskroom/cask/powershell'

Error: No available Cask for Caskroom/cask/powershell
Error: nothing to install

comments.author: childnode
comments.body:
same problem here for me @amuessig but : seems to be a brew problem at all - https://github.com/caskroom/homebrew-cask/blob/master/Casks/powershell.rb ✅ - `brew update` and `brew cask update` ✅ - `brew doctor` was ok ✅ - `/usr/local/Library/Taps/caskroom/homebrew-cask/Casks` is outdated 🔴
^ so for me, it was hung up on master@[e283474 where no powershell.rb is in](https://github.com/caskroom/homebrew-cask/blob/e283474/Casks/powershell.rb)
^ so: go into this dir, then `$ git fetch --all && git reset --hard origin/master` P.S: the known bug is documented right on the [brew site's README](https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/): > **Update Bug** > > If Homebrew was updated on Aug 10-11th 2016 and brew update always says Already up-to-date. you need to run: > > `cd $(brew --repo); git fetch; git reset --hard origin/master; brew update` btw. to all that "use brew cask" callers: cask is not a solution to some of us but simple and helpful for others. It (cask brew formular) more or less just takes down the huddle for you to download, verify the signature, run the installer, cleanup after uninstall. It doesn't do any recompile. It needs to re-download the complete package anytime.
